description: From Latin Lacōnicus (“Spartan”), from Ancient Greek Λακωνικός (Lakōnikós, “Laconian”). Laconia was the region inhabited and ruled by the Spartans, who were known for their brevity in speech.

adjectives.description: laconic (comparative more laconic, superlative most laconic)

entries.meaning: Using as few words as possible; pithy and concise.
